thread.title: Outdoors: Calendar, Oct. 2-17
thread.title_full: Outdoors: Calendar, Oct. 2-17 - San Antonio Express-News

author: John Goodspeed
title: Outdoors: Calendar, Oct. 2-17
text:
Saturday
Texas Wildlife Association : Lone Star Water Forum 2015, with authorities speaking on desalination as a solution, Washington County Fair Grounds Event Center , 1305 E. Blue Bell Road, Brenham. $25. $10 for live video broadcast. Click on texas-wildlife.org or call 979-541-9803.
South Texas Pistoleros: Monthly match of the cowboy action shooting club, 8 a.m., Cowboy Action Shooting Range at A Place To Shoot, 13250 Pleasanton Road. Nonmembers welcome. Call 210-661-3550 or 210-628-1888 or visit stxpistolaros.com.
Tuesday
Alamo Arms Collectors Association: Monthly meeting, 6:30 p.m., San Pedro Church of Christ, 311 Jackson-Keller Road. Nonmembers welcome. Call George Stenzel , 210-523-5540.
Oct. 9-11
Texas Outdoor Family: Hands-on basics of camping for those with little or no experience with tent, gear provided, Garner State Park. $65 for family of up to six. Call 512-389-8903 or email tofsp@tpwd.texas.gov .
Texas Wildlife Association: Women of the land, a stewardship workshop for female landowners, land managers, hunters and wildlife enthusiasts, Camp Allen , Navasota. Click on texas-wildlife.org.
Oct. 9
Operation Game Thief: Alamo Area Clay Stoppers Shootout sporting clays tournament, 7:30 a.m.-5 p.m., National Shooting Complex, 5931 Roft Road. Team of four, $1,000; youth team of four, $800; individual, $250. Call 512-389-4381 or click on ogttx.com.
Oct. 10
Texas Parks & Wildlife Department: Basics of outdoor photography workshop, Government Canyon State Park 9 a.m.-6 p.m. Includes composition, exposure, field tactics. $100. Click on txoutdoorphotoworkshops.com.
Palmetto State Park: Fishing with a Ranger, a program for beginners outlining the basics, 10-11 a.m. Some loaner poles and tackle available. Bring your own bait. Free with park admission. Call 830-672-3266 or click on tpwd.texas.gov.
Friends of Government Canyon SNA : Hike the Canyon, a four-to-seven-mile hike at the state natural area for ages 13 and older accompanied by adult, 12861 Galm Road, 8:30 a.m.-noon. Meet at Visitors Center. Entrance fee. RSVP not required. Call 210-688-9055, Ext. 289, or click on friendsofgc.org.
San Antonio Audubon Society: Beginner’s Bird Walk, 8 a.m., Judson Nature Trails, 246 Viesca St., Alamo Heights. Nonmembers welcome. Free. Call Georgina Schwartz , 210-342-2073, or click on saaudubon.org.
Texican Rangers: Monthly match of the cowboy action shooting club, 8 a.m., on the Stieler Ranch on U.S. 87 between Fredericksburg and Comfort. Call 210-657-6538 or visit texicanrangers.org.
Oct. 13
The Well Armed Woman: San Antonio chapter’s monthly meeting of the women-only group for education on firearms, 6-8 p.m., Nardis Gun Club , 4818 I-10 East. Email michelecrippen1@gmail.com or click on thewellarmedwoman.com.
Oct. 15
Saltwater-fisheries Enhancement Association: Monthly meeting, 7 p.m., The BBQ Station, 1610 N.E. Loop 410. Non-members welcome. Call 210-477-3037 or click on sea-sa.com.
Oct. 17
Friends of Government Canyon SNA: Explore the Canyon, a hike guided by authorities on flora, fauna, geology and cultural history of the state natural area, 12861 Galm Road, 8:30 a.m.-noon. Meet at Visitors Center. Entrance fee. RSVP not required. Call 210-688-9055, Ext. 289, or click on friendsofgc.org.
Alamo Area Moderators: Monthly match of the cowboy action shooting club, 8 a.m., Lone Star Weapons and Tactics Range, 5419 FM 1343, Devine. 210-493-9320 or alamoareamoderators.com.
Tejas Caballeros: Monthly match of the cowboy action shooting club, 8 a.m., on a private range near Driftwood. 512-894-0897 or tejascaballeros.org.
Have an item for the Outdoor Calendar? Email John Goodspeed at john@johngoodspeed.com .
